place.name: LLANFIHANGEL NANT BRAN
place.gazetteerText: LLANFIHANGEL-NANT-BRANE, a parish, with a small village, in the district and county of Brecon; on the river Bran, an affluent of the Usk, 8 miles NW by W of Brecon r. station. Post town, Brecon. Acres, 9,161. Real property, £2,516. Pop., 453. Houses, 96. The property is subdivided.—The parish is cut into two sections, Lower and Upper. I he living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £66. Patrons, the Coheirs of the late W. Jeffreys, Esq. The church is tolerable; and there is a Calvinistic Methodist chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
